children.label: Cream
children.description: Can be eaten as an accompaniment to desserts or used as a cooking ingredient.

children.label: Yoghurt
children.description: A semi-solid food prepared from milk fermented by added bacteria, often sweetened and flavoured.

children.label: Milk
children.description: The milk from cows (or goats or sheep)

children.label: Egg
children.description: An oval or round object laid by a female bird

children.label: Orange
children.description: A large round juicy citrus fruit with a tough bright reddish-yellow rind.

children.label: Lemon
children.description: A pale yellow oval citrus fruit with thick skin and fragrant, acidic juice.

children.label: Mango
children.description: A fleshy, oval, yellowish-red tropical fruit that is eaten ripe or used green for pickles or chutneys.

children.label: Blueberries
children.description: a small sweet blue-black edible berry which grows in clusters on North American shrubs related to the bilberry.

children.label: Strawberries
children.description: a sweet soft red fruit with a seed-studded surface.

children.label: Carrots
children.description: A tapering orange-coloured root eaten as a vegetable.

children.label: Zucchini
children.description: The immature fruit of a vegetable marrow; a courgette.

children.label: Tomatoes
children.description: A glossy red, or occasionally yellow, pulpy edible fruit that is eaten as a vegetable or in salad.

children.label: Eggplant
children.description: The purple egg-shaped fruit of a tropical Old World plant, which is eaten as a vegetable; an aubergine.

children.label: Cocoa
children.description: a powder made from roasted and ground cacao seeds.

children.label: Sugar
children.description: A sweet crystalline substance obtained from various plants, especially sugar cane and sugar beet, consisting essentially of sucrose, and used as a sweetener in food and drink.

children.label: Almonds
children.description: The oval edible nutlike seed (kernel) of the almond tree, growing in a woody shell, widely used as food.

children.label: Cashew nuts
children.description: An edible kidney-shaped nut, rich in oil and protein, which is roasted and shelled before it can be eaten.

children.label: Bacon
children.description: Cured meat from the back or sides of a pig.

children.label: Ham
children.description: Salted or smoked meat from the upper part of a pig's leg.

children.label: Sausage
children.description: A cylindrical length of minced pork or other meat encased in a skin, typically sold raw to be grilled or fried before eating.

children.label: Beef
children.description: The meat of a cow, bull, or ox.

children.label: Lamb
children.description: The meat of a lamb as food.

children.label: Chicken
children.description: Meat from a chicken.

children.label: Paprika
children.description: A powdered spice with a deep orange-red colour and a mildly pungent flavour, made from the dried and ground fruits of certain varieties of pepper.

children.label: Cinnamon
children.description: An aromatic spice made from the peeled, dried, and rolled bark of a SE Asian tree.

children.label: Garlic powder
children.description: Garlic powder is a spice that is derived from dehydrated garlic and used in cooking for flavour enhancement.

children.label: Onion powder
children.description: Onion powder is dehydrated, ground onion that is commonly used as a seasoning.

children.label: Breads
children.description: Food made of flour, water, and yeast mixed together and baked.

children.label: Rice
children.description: The grains of rice

children.label: Corn
children.description: The grain of a cereal crop

children.label: Noodles
children.description: A very thin, long strip of pasta or a similar flour paste, eaten with a sauce or in a soup.

children.label: Honey
children.description: A sweet, sticky yellowish-brown fluid made by bees and other insects from nectar collected from flowers.
